function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Unclean or inadequate maintenance of ventilation systems can lead to reduced system efficiency and accumulation of contaminants, contributing to indoor air pollution.","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of proper hvac system maintenance and operation","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate control of hvac system fan","category":"Air","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Improper indoor temperature range in hvac system","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate hvac filter efficiency and capacity","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Improper filter use in older home furnaces","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Airborne transmission of sars-cov-2contaminated aerosols","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation in nonmedical settings","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate natural ventilation may limit the dilution of indoor air and increase the risk of airborne transmission of contagious diseases","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate mechanical ventilation systems may fail to regulate good indoor air quality and control infection transmission","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Airborne transmission of sars-cov-2 virus in medical settings due to aerosol-generating procedures","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation in healthcare settings leading to increased risk of infection transmission","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Respiratory droplet transmission of sars-cov-2 virus","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Fomite transmission of sars-cov-2 virus","category":"Air","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Uncertainty about the contribution of small respirable particles to close proximity transmission","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Transmission of covid-19 and other infectious diseases through aerosols and contaminated surfaces in indoor spaces.","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential spread of viruses in indoor environments due to lack of contactless systems and air purification.","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased energy costs and greenhouse gas emissions if uv filter glass and transparent solar panels are not properly implemented.","category":"Energy Cycle","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Risk of ineffective or improper implementation of air purification systems and antimicrobial materials.","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation leading to poor indoor air quality and increased risk of disease transmission","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of proper cleaning strategies and technologies leading to increased pathogen transmission","category":"Soil","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Inadequate design for pandemic response leading to lack of emergency facilities and infrastructure","category":"Settlement","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Utilizing uvgi technology without proper precautions for human exposure to uv radiation","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential reliance on a single bio sensor for virus detection","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Implementation of plastic barriers without proper maintenance and monitoring","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Exposure to uv radiation from mobile uv devices","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Ineffective or inadequate use of bipolar ionization devices","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Failure to detect viruses in buildings","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate understanding of paint nature and endurance","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Improper installation or maintenance of air ionization systems","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of copper touch surfaces in existing buildings","category":"Soil","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of antimicrobial paint on surfaces","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Existing buildings not designed to reduce transmission of communicable diseases","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of smart building materials containing titanium dioxide tio2 nanoparticles for depollution","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation and air filtration in buildings","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Indoor air pollution from building materials and products","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Bio composite materials as an alternative to reduce indoor air pollutants","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Nbpi may produce reactive ions and reactive oxygen species in the air, which could have unknown health effects.","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Installation of uvgi without proper maintenance can lead to reduced effectiveness and potential health risks from exposure to uv light.","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inconsistent implementation and maintenance of vertical greening systems may result in reduced air purification efficiency and potential structural damage to buildings.","category":"Water Cycle","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of hygienic flooring materials such as wood, bamboo, and cork may not be effective in preventing virus for disinfection may lead to ineffective virus control.","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Insufficient ventilation due to conflicting guidelines on co2 concentration and quality and contamination hazards","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Non-thermal plasma technology airphx reducing viruses, bacteria, and mold by 90-99% in the air and on
